citation.article-title: Balneola alkaliphila sp. nov., a marine bacterium isolated from the Mediterranean Sea.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Balneola alkaliphila sp. nov.
Balneola alkaliphila (al.ka.li.phi′la. N.L. n. alkali alkali; Gr. adj. philos loving; N.L. fem. adj. alkaliphila loving alkaline conditions).
Growth occurs at 15–37 °C (optimum, 25 °C), at pH 6.0–10.0 (optimum, 8.0–9.0) and at salinities of 10–80 g NaCl l−1 (optimum, 30 g NaCl l−1).
Positive reactions with Biolog GN2 plates are obtained for d-fructose, turanose, acetate, citrate, d-glucosaminic acid and inosine.
Positive reactions (API ZYM) are obtained for alkaline phosphatase, leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase and trypsin.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 39 mol%.
The type strain, CM41_14bT (=DSM 19538T=CIP 109603T=OOB 103T), was isolated from a water column in the bay of Banyuls-sur-Mer.
